thread.title: Men who died in head-on smash on State Highway 1 near Karapiro named
thread.title_full: Men who died in head-on smash on State Highway 1 near Karapiro named

author: Phillipa Yalden
title: Men who died in head-on smash on State Highway 1 near Karapiro named
text:
Men who died in head-on smash on State Highway 1 near Karapiro named PHILLIPA YALDEN Last updated 13:36, February 4 2017 DOMINICO ZAPATA/FAIRFAX NZ 
One of the two cars involved in Friday's double fatal crash on SH1. 
Police have released the identities of the two men who died in a head-on crash on State Highway 1 in the Waikato. 
They were Wiremu Gin, 38, from Kaikohe, and Timothy Amai, 21, from Hamilton. 
The pair, along with a dog that died, occupied one of two cars involved in the crash on State Highway 1 near the Tauranga turnoff, near Karapiro, at 9.50am on Friday. DOMINICO ZAPATA/FAIRFAX NZ 
Two men died in a collision on State Highway 1 near the SH29 intersection. 
The driver of the other car was taken to Waikato Hospital in a moderate condition. 
READ MORE: Two dead after blackspot crash 
Initial indications show the vehicles were travelling in opposite directions when they crashed head-on on SH1 about 10 metres from the intersection with SH29, Senior Sergeant Pete van de Wetering said. 
"It is a timely reminder to everyone to slow down, pay attention, drive to conditions and don't be distracted by anything on the roads." 
The crash on the busy 100kmh stretch of highway between Hamilton and Tauranga was shut down for several hours and reopened about 4pm on Friday. 
The cause of the crash is being investigated by the Serious Crash Unit. 
Next of kin have been notified, police said.
